content: I find it tedious to check if the Lean and Mathlib versions are out of date and update them. Couldn't something be made that would automatically submit a PR when the version becomes a certain degree out of date? What I want can be described as a Lean version of dependabot.
My impression was that the Lean Together talks by Mac about reservoir and by Alex Best about leaff were going in this direction.
We used to have a GitHub action for this in the Lean 3 days, it will probably come back one day.

FWIW for Dependabot itself it basically doesn't add new languages. Even a language like Clojure doesn't have support for it, and there's no roadmap AFAIK for getting there -- leading to hacks like https://github.com/frenchy64/dependabot-lein-via-mvn

For bumping lean versions I use https://github.com/Julian/homebrew-lean/blob/dc583af6cf0ce4b254a87002758c44b0e24ac2c5/.github/workflows/update-tap.yml#L22 in one place to stay up to date with Mathlib's Lean version but that's quite non-generalized clearly.

@Julian Berman Thanks!! Your workflow looks nice.

By the way, is homebrew needed for lean updates?

No not at all, I'd ignore the rest of the actual contents of that repo, it's basically something I use myself but isn't really appropriate for use by anyone else without some extra work that I haven't done.
(The "update using Mathlib4's toolchain" bit though of course might be useful, hence linking it.)
Ok. With the help of the code you gave me, I could (maybe) create an action that automatically notifies me when a new Lean is released and is out of date. Thank you!
Asei Inoue has marked this topic as resolved.

I've got a similar script for lean4-cli that notifies me on Zulip if things stop building with a new Lean version: https://github.com/leanprover/lean4-cli/blob/main/.github/workflows/check_nightly.yml
The only issue is that GitHub tries to turn off the action every couple of months because lean4-cli is sufficiently stable that it doesn't really see many commits. Fortunately, that can be circumvented with a few clicks every time it comes up.
